page.title: 01Wem - An introduction
page.content: Wem is a small town of about 4,500 people on the flat, fertile land of north Shropshire. It grew up as a market town and agriculture is still the main employer.In the town there are a large brewery, an animal feeds mill and a sawmill and joinery, plus several firms that construct farm buildings or install equipment.Many other people work in the local council offices or commute to Shrewsbury, only 15 minutes away by train. Wem lies away from main trunk roads but apart from a hospital, it has most of the things that people need. Besides a good range of shops,there are many clubs and activities sporting, social and academic. A typical example is the annual carnival held in September. Local people are proud of their town. Few people move into or out of the area.
